text: hello this is Bill Cunningham at that
notorious the Windy corner of Fifth
Avenue and 23rd Street early in the last
century the police and directed traffic
from towers in the middle of Fifth
Avenue would often call out to the men
gathered skidoo because the men were
there to see the wind blow up the
woman's skirts so it became 23 skidoo of
course skirts have just about vanished
from fashion pants replaced them but now
you have a new generation who have
discovered as you'll see all winter the
wide brimmed felt hats and of course
they have yet to learn to hold on to
them in the wind and it was fabulous to
see unsuspecting women come along and
suddenly these ferocious lasts of wind
of nearly knocked you over and they're
grabbing their coats to keep them down
and trying to hold their hats and their
little dogs it was if what a scene and
full of nostalgia it was wonderful but
it emphasized to me the fashion world
and its new intoxication with
wide-brimmed felt hands you know you
have vanity and a conceit just
unexpectedly hit by these Cyclones of
wind it just a lovely portrait I thought
of New York in mid-march
